description: The request for proposal (RFP) is for the provision of aftercare psychology services for parolees and probationers at the Windsor parole office
full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement

### Tender Notice

The Correctional Service of Canada is seeking proposals for Psychology Services for the Windsor Parole Office.

### Contract Details

* Reference Number: cb-8497-42074369
* Solicitation Number: 21470-27-4312147
* Tender Closing Date: 2023-09-08T14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2023-10-01
* Expected Contract End Date: 2026-09-30

### Procurement Details

* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price
* Trade Agreements: None

### Services Required

The successful contractor will provide aftercare psychology services to offenders at the Windsor Parole Office. The services include:

* Psychological assessment and/or treatment services as a registered psychologist in Ontario for a maximum of 140 hours per year
* Providing evidence-based treatments with known application to offender populations
* Addressing the offender's motivation for the index offence
* Considering gender, cultural, religious, and linguistic differences, and being responsive to the special needs of women and Indigenous people
* Providing services in accordance with federal and provincial legislation, standards, and policies

### Submission Requirements

* Documents may be submitted in either English or French
* Bidders must download the solicitation document and associated documents from the Canada Buys/Tender Opportunities website
* After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process

### Contact Information

* Jill Emmons, Contracting Authority
* Telephone: (613) 329-2694
* Email: Jill.Emmons@csc-scc.gc.ca
S/she is the primary contact for this procurement.

### Notes to Bidders

* The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement
* Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada
